meanings.definition: Outintrigues (verb): surpasses in cunning or deceit
meanings.sent1: She outintrigues her opponents by always staying one step ahead.
meanings.sent2: He outintrigues his classmates with his clever pranks.
meanings.sent3: The detective outintrigues the thief by setting up a clever trap.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outintrigue others is like a chess master planning their next move.
meanings.sent5: The spy's skills at outintriguing are unmatched in the agency.

meanings.definition: Outintrigues (adjective): more cunning or deceitful than others
meanings.sent1: She is the most outintrigues person in the office, always coming up with sneaky plans.
meanings.sent2: The outintrigues fox managed to steal all the chickens from the farm.
meanings.sent3: The outintrigues cat managed to open the locked door with its clever paws.
meanings.sent4: His outintrigues behavior at the party raised suspicions among the guests.
meanings.sent5: The outintrigues villain always had a trick up his sleeve to outsmart the hero.

meanings.definition: Outintrigues (noun): the act of surpassing others in cunning or deceit
meanings.sent1: Her outintrigues in the game of poker earned her the title of champion.
meanings.sent2: The outintrigues of the con artist left everyone in awe of his skills.
meanings.sent3: The outintrigues of the magician's tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The outintrigues of the spy's mission kept everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The outintrigues of the plot twist in the movie caught everyone by surprise.
